div.p: Unit 2, p. 520, VPRS 7936/P1 outward letterbooks of the Secretary for Lands, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Adverting to the notification in the Government Gazette of the 27th ultimo,
Victoria Government Gazette, 27 August 1867, p. 1595. The notice announced the appointment of M, Charles Ligar, Clement Hodgkinson, William Wardell, Robert Brough Smyth and Thomas Couchman to a Board of Inquiry regarding the State Forests of Victoria. of the appointment by His Excellency The Governor in Council of a Board of inquiry regarding the State Forests of Victoria, I am requested to invite your attendance at a meeting of the Board to be held in the Board room at this Office on Thursday next the 5th instant, at 2 p.m.

Although the original letter carried the name of Charles Ligar, the Surveyor-General, a MS annotation by Lewis stated that similar letters had been addressed by him to : 'The Inspector General of Public Works' [Wardell]; 'The Director of the Botanic Gardens'; 'The Secretary for Mines &c' [Smyth] and 'The Chief Mining Surveyor' [Couchman].
